Definition: Optimization Model for reducing Emissions of Greenhouse Gasses from Automobiles
Consumer recognizable name of historical vehicles (e.g. "Cruze")
Consumer recognizable brand of a historical vehicle (e.g. "Chevrolet")
Company that is treated as a regulated entity (e.g. "General Motors")
Ths is too ambiguous without further clarification. See "WORD" instead.
Within any given baseline scenario, the decision to adopt no new OTAQ regulatory actions beyond the existing regulations
A set of definitions that fully describe the OTAQ regulations under consideration
The vehicles and their attributes that have already been produced in reality, up to and including the initial year
The last year of the historical fleet, and the initial condition for the first of year of modeling
The set of historical vehicles as they are modeled beyond the initial year
The number of vehicles and their attributes registered at a given time (Legacy Fleet + Compliance Fleet)
The number of vehicles registered at a given time
The fleet of modeled vehicles with MY>Initial Year
Calendar year minus model year (age 0 = MY 2020 vehicles in CY 2020)
Ratio of useful work to total fuel energy
Incremental percentage reduction in CO2 emissions between two packages
The set of assumptions about the future within which the policies are evaluated. Note that all contexts must be internally consistent
Encompasses both the No-action Alternative and the Action Alternatives. This is a more generic term than the alternatives.
Too ambiguous without further clarification - avoid using without clarification
The set of Contexts that encompass uncertainty of the future (fuel prices, sales, adoption rates, etc.)
